intro: Crocus akkayaensis, commonly known as the Akkaya crocus, is a rare and endemic species native to Turkey. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with a distinctive yellow center. The plant typically grows in rocky and calcareous soils, thriving in alpine and subalpine habitats. It blooms in late winter to early spring, making it one of the earliest flowering plants in its region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
